intro: Randia spinifex, commonly known as the spiny randia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and thorny stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting well to saline environments. Randia spinifex is often found in dune ecosystems, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes.
